title: County police looking into Crofton shooting
content:
County detectives are looking for more information about a shooting that occurred in Crofton Tuesday night.
Around 6:03 p.m., officers responded to a shooting near Holly Hill Lane and Reed Drive. The caller said that a male victim was "accidentally" shot in the leg and that the caller, victim and suspect all knew each other, police said. The caller also said the victim and suspect fled the scene in the car where the victim was shot.
The victim then called 9-1-1 a short time after the initial call. He said he had been shot during an attempted robbery "near a Royal Farm store somewhere on (Route) 3," police said. Officers then responded to the 2900 block of Cold Spring Way where they found the victim suffering from a gunshot wound to the leg.
The victim was transported to University of Maryland Shock Trauma Center in Baltimore with non-life threatening injuries. Officers also went to Royal Farm stores along Route 3, but couldn't find a crime scene.
County detectives are following up with an investigation, police said.
